titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Accounts for Supplies and Equipment from the Virginia Land Office, 1792-1812
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia LOI 8
titlepage.author: Claire Radcliffe

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Accounts for Supplies and Equipment from the Virginia Land Office, 1792-1812

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia. Land Office. Accounts for Supplies and Equipment from the Virginia Land Office, 1792-1812. Accession Land Office inventory entry no. 8, State government records collection, The Library of Virginia, Archives Branch, Richmond, VA 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Accession LOI 8 transferred by the Secretary of the Commonwealth, 1948.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: These records include accounts and receipts for the maintenance of the Land Office, including such items as coal, parchment, printing, salaries, ink, and blank books, covering the period 1792-1795 and 1810-1812. Charles Lewis and Charles Blagrove served as registers of the Land Office during these periods and were involved in the accounts for the office maintenance.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following series:

list.item: I. Accounts for Supplies and Equipment, 1792-1812.
